titleStmt.title: By the Queene whereas the Queenes Maiestie our soueraigne lady by reason of the plague and pestilence in the citie of London dyd lately by her proclamation adiourne part of the tearme of S. Michael ... Her Maiestie is therefore forced ... to adiourne the rest of the said tearme ...
titleStmt.author: England and Wales. Sovereign (1558-1603 : Elizabeth I)
Elizabeth I, Queen of England, 1533-1603.

publicationStmt.publisher: Imprinted at London in Powles Churchyarde by Richard Iugge and Iohn Cawood [i.e. B. Norton and J. Bill] ... ,

notesStmt.note: Second part of title from first 10 lines of text.
Publishers and date of imprint suggested by STC (2nd ed.).
"Geuen at her Maiesties Castel of Windsor the xxiii. day of October, in the eleuenth yeere of her Maiesties raigne."
Reproduction of original in the Harvard University. Library.
